name: Churros de pescado

ingredients: 1 egg yolk (if you decide to double the recipe, it's alright to use the whole egg instead)
350 g merluza (hake in English. Found in the freezer section. You can use 300 or 400 too. Without fishbones it's better.
Tip of a tsp of turmeric (colorant substitute)
3/4 tsp salt (4 g. If you taste one and it's bland for you just sprinkle some salt on both sides)

instructions: - Mix well 50 g of beer with everything except the fish and flour (pre-soaked saffron is better).
- Add the rest of the flour and beer, combine and soak the fish in it (previously cut into strips)
- Leave at least half an hour and fry on a shallow pan on medium-high heat.

culinary: To fry on a shallow pan, sear the pieces and then fry for longer on each side until golden.

To improve the colour an artificial colorant popular in Spain called tartrazine is used. However I don't think it's healthy, so I've used ingredients that may not be commonly used but help us reach the desired colour naturally.
